results.title: Soviet Union: faces of today
results.creator_credit: Arnold Michaelis, Milan Herzog, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Novosti Press Agency
results.brief_description: Presents individuals from diverse segments of Soviet society to call attention to the size and regional variety of the Soviet Union and their ways of life.

results.title: The Soviet Union: a student's life
results.brief_description: Looks at the structure of Soviet education, including early schooling, vocational schools, rigidity and difficulty of higher education. Explains the social and recreational life of students as well as the importance of school-state relationship.

results.title: What's your authority?
results.creator_credit: Gregory Heimer and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents two episodes involving children confronting the problems of authority. Examines the kinds of authority found in our society and the individual’s relation to authority. Produced by Greg Heimer in collaboration with Lawrence Kohlberg, Phd. Harvard.

results.title: [Plum pudding: a collection of 8 short animated films]
results.brief_description: This collection of short animated films directed by eight film students at the Newton Creative Arts Center shows a diverse range of issues that are laced to motivate and for showing students’ achievements. This creative media allows a mixture of students to experiment with film and animation.

results.title: [Wool Fashion Awards, 1965 and 1966]
results.brief_description: Models show a variety of garments which won the Fashion Awards for 1966. Knitted jumpers, suits, skirts, and day and evening dresses, ensembles and coats. Photographed at Eltham using Montsalvat as a background.

results.title: The Woodwind choir
results.brief_description: The individual tonal range and qualities of the various woodwind instruments used in a symphony orchestra, and the techniques of playing them, are demonstrated in this film. Compositions by Brahms, Mendelssohn, Rossini, von Weber, Beethoven, and Schumann are used to demonstrate the function of woodwind instruments in full orchestral setting.

results.title: Flat
results.brief_description: Carried out in a 2D reality, repetitive motions mirror the mechanical patterns in modern society. In this one-shot abstracted sequence, abscuring motion and direction, repeated gestures move beyond meaning and into compulsive necessity. Detail magnifies while reason fades.
results.description: Carried out in a 2D reality, repetitive motions mirror the mechanical patterns in modern society. In this one-shot abstracted sequence, abscuring motion and direction, repeated gestures move beyond meaning and into compulsive necessity. Detail magnifies while reason fades.
